rooms.description: An open entrance hall with a small reception area; designed to adhere to Vastu principles by ensuring auspicious entry.
A spacious living area with Kerala-style wooden paneling and traditional motifs; includes a central coffee table to maintain energy flow per Vastu guidelines.
A compact dining area with a traditional Kerala wood finish; positioned to enhance the flow of positive energy.
A functional kitchen with minimalistic design and ample storage, ensuring proper positioning for Vastu compliance.
A guest room designed to be quiet and serene with Kerala-style decor; includes traditional shutters for privacy.
A small but functional bathroom adjacent to the guest room; includes a traditional Kerala-style water feature.
A bathroom serving the living area; designed with Vastu recommendations for water placements.
A dedicated gym space on the ground floor; utilizes compact and multi-purpose equipment to stay within budget.
A utility area for storage of gym equipment and other essentials; designed to be discreet while functional.

openings.description: Main entrance door oriented to the north-east for Vastu compliance.
Window in the entrance hall to allow natural light, positioned in alignment with Vastu principles.
Large window in living room to enhance natural ventilation and positive energy flow.
Kitchen window ensuring proper light entry; positioned per Vastu guidelines.

vastu_comments.entrance: Main entrance door is aligned to the north-east for auspicious energy.
vastu_comments.layout_orientation: The triplex Nalukettu layout is designed with a centralized courtyard concept, ensuring balance and harmony in spatial distribution.
vastu_comments.budget_considerations: Rooms have been sized modestly with multifunctional spaces (e.g., guest room doubling as study) to maintain budget constraints while adhering to traditional Kerala aesthetics.
